content: d e s i g n b y v i n t h e r tea & coffee potholders interlocking crochet technique yarn 100% cotton 8/4 crochet hook 3mm finished size 22 x 23 cm stitches used us terms chain chain skip skip double_crochet double_crochet dcib double_crochet back dcif double_crochet front single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet abbreviations in instruction examples b1 dcib ch1 b4 dcib ch1 x 4 f1 dcif ch1 f3 dcif ch1 x3 notes to the pattern the potholder is worked in 2 colours let s call them a&b where the dark colour is to highlight the pattern and the light colour is the background if you want to follow the chart the vertical lines represent the dark colour a while the horizontal lines represent the light colour b tip on uneven row ex 3 vertical lines = colour a / double_crochet in front on even row ex 2 vertical lines = colour a / double_crochet in back on uneven row ex 3 horizontal lines = colour b / double_crochet in back on even row ex 2 horizontal lines = colour b / double_crochet in front if you follow the written instructions when working uneven row you will be facing the front of the pattern and when working the even row the back is facing you every row is worked in both colours first the dark a and then the light b when working the row you will only crochet a colour into a colour stitches and b colour into b coloured stitches they will not mix throughout the whole pattern all row start with ch4 in order to make it easier to pick up the yarn after each round i suggest to end each row with ch4 then you will have this little tail to pick up when you work that colour again at then end of each row make the double_crochet around the ch4 instead of trying to get into the chain with a small tug it will form into a square/window at the end of all b row the double_crochet is not followed by a ch1 the very last row 25 is only worked with colour a when finishing the potholder it is possible to make a border as follows with colour b only colour b windows make 2 single_crochet in every window 5 single_crochet in each corner end by making a invisible needle join into the first single_crochet with colour a only on colour a windows start making chain 25 hanging loop slipstitch in same corner sides make 2 half_double_crochet in first window corner continue with 2 half_double_crochet in each a window corners make 2 half_double_crochet 1 half_double_crochet grabbing the middle single_crochet of colour b corner 2 half_double_crochet this will anchor the corners together with b windows for a neater look end 2 half_double_crochet in last window 25 single_crochet around the hanging loop and join to the first half_double_crochet with needle join and anchor to the white corner also this is my very first
